results.title: Back room of the sky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
A survey of work carried out at the Ministry of Aviation Research Centre at Boscombe Down. Aiming always for increased safety and efficiency, all sections of a new aircraft must be rigorously tested and teams of pilots, scientists and engineers seek out any flaws which must be corrected before a machine becomes operational. The men who will fly the aircraft are also seen undergoing tests at Boscombe Down. Narrated by Raymond Baxter.

results.title: Back pain. Migraine
results.creator_credit: Annie Moore, Serena Macbeth, Discovery Networks Europe and B-line Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Alternative”.
This episode of the fifteen part television series on complementary health focuses on two separate segments: “Back pain” and “Migraine”. Dealing with back pain first, it is said that two-thirds of the population in the United Kingdom suffers from this physical ailment and that it is the second most common problem after heart disease. Back pain is usually caused through spinal disorders from accidents, sport injuries and work related physical stress. Treatment can be obtained from a range of practitioners including Osteopaths, Chiropractors, Physiotherapists and non-surgical medical practitioners. Using case studies, the following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Alexander technique/swimming; Osteopathy; Bowen technique; Electro-crystal therapy; Pilates. The second segment covers migraines which can be triggered off through various reasons including over exertion or stress causing tightness in the muscles. 60% of migraines are caused by displaced vertebrates in the cervical spine and can consist of many different symptoms, including headache, nausea, aversion to light and sound, vomiting, tiredness, It usually affects half the head and can sometimes create a sensititvity to alcohol, citrus, cheese, chocolate and other food types. The following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Magnet therapy; Osteopathy; 5-Element acupuncture; integrated treatment including therapeutic yoga, relaxation, breathing exercises, specific neck and spine exercises. Commentary by Dilly Barlow.

results.title: Back injury
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Many people suffer from back pain at some stage of their lives. This film studies the option that one man chose in order to try to relieve his pain.

results.title: Back in circulation
results.brief_description: This film looks at a group of amputee soldiers, shortly after the Second World War. It looks at their rehabilitation, beginning with a visit to the “Limbless Soldiers Association, N.S.W.Aquatic Club” where soldiers come together for a water carnival. The film goes on to the Lady Gowrie Hospital and the Rehabilitation Artificial Limb Factory where the workers are amputees. No other credits available.

results.title: Back from the Brink
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “History in action”.
During the last week of October 1962, the world lived on the knife-edge as the two Superpowers faced each other over the Cuban Crisis. Russia was keen to have a base closer to America, just as America had power and bases surrounding Soviet territory. On the 29th October, 1962, the two Superpowers stepped back from the brink of war. Was the present agreement a new start or only a truce?

results.title: Back fire
results.brief_description: Elli the Elephant is desperate, dateless and bored watching Backfire, a feature drama where a hunky fire fighting elephant saves a damsel in distress from a towering inferno and takes her off for a sunset romance. After noticing a box of matches and full waste paper bin, she has an idea. What follow is a comedy of errors when the hunky fire fighting elephants end up proving to be bungling fools and she ends up having to save the day.

results.title: Bachdisc
results.brief_description: The Bachdisc marks a milestone in the treatment of musical subjects in laserdisc format. How does one add visually to something that is not only heard, but is considered to be the most subjective of the arts? Bachdisc creator, Juan Downey, incorporates onto a multiple-image screen various images of the famous New York harpsichordist Elaine Comparone playing Bach’s Fugue #24 in B minor. On side 2 of the disc is a documentary of Bach’s personal life and work.

results.title: Bach flower remedies: a further understanding
results.brief_description: The Bach Flower Remedies represent a system of healing for the personality and temperament. Their purpose is to help to re-establish emotional equilibrium and thus act as an aid to one’s own natural healing. This interesting and informative video gives a general guide to Dr Edward Bach’s flower remedies. Bach believed that the real cause of an illness was the mental state or temperament of the patient and not the condition of their body. Using flowers from plants and trees, Bach had, by the time of his death, discovered 38 remedies which he divided into seven groups: fear; uncertainty; insufficient interest in present circumstances; loneliness; over-sensitivity to influence and ideas; despondency or despair; over care for the welfare of others. Filmed at Mount Vernon, the cottage in Oxfordshire where Dr Edward Bach spent the last years of his life, Brenda Longman (presenter and narrator) discusses various aspects of the remedies with John Ramsell and Judy Howard (trustees and curators of Mount Vernon) including a demonstration in making up the remedies, the process of determining the right remedy for a particular type of person, self-help advice and examples of remedies for depression and anger. A recommended reading list is provided at the end of the program.

results.title: Babyhood
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, George Luger and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
A paediatrician analyses the stages of development during the first year of a child’s life. Suggestions are made for cheap and easily improvised play materials and toys.

results.title: Baby story
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto Films and Bruno Bozzetto
results.brief_description: Bozzetto’s animated comic version of life in the womb. Illustrates the struggle of the sperm to fertilise the ovum when opposed by contraceptives.
